newsitem.title: GERMANY: German shares stumble at outset of bourse dealings.
newsitem.headline: German shares stumble at outset of bourse dealings.

text.p: German shares stumbled in early dealings on Friday, hurt by profit-taking ahead of the weekend and selling tied to the expiry later in the day of options on the DAX index.
The 30-share DAX index down 34.85 points at 4,192.46 points. The IBIS DAX, which reflects all-day computer dealings, was down 11.66 points at 4,192.25 points.

"I think the market looks a bit tired," said one Frankfurt dealer. "We could fall rather quickly today like we did on Thursday for no apparent reason. The market needs to take a rest before moving higher."

Some traders looked for the DAX to find support at about 4,155 to 4,160 points on any pull-back, saying the losses would be constructive for the market to post further gains and reach new record levels.
Dealers linked some of the losses to the expiry of the DAX options amid signs of heavy open interest at 4,200 points.
"We should hover around the 4,200-point level but the risk is obviously to the downside," said one trader.
Overnight losses on Wall Street and losses in German debt markets, worried about the risk of a Bundesbank rate hike to curb the dollar's strength, also capped market interest.
The market showed little reaction to the June Ifo business climate index report for west Germany, which rose beyond market expectations in June to 96.0 from a revised 95.4 in May.
In east Germany, the climate reading eased back slightly with the index at 103.6 from an upward revised 103.7 in May.
Despite the general downward trend, banking stocks were in the focus after Commerzbank AG predicted many banks will report double-digit growth in first-half operating profit.
The report also said banking shares may also get a boost from speculation for mergers in the industry due to recent consolidation in the insurance sector.
Deutsche Bank AG, which will report results on July 23, rose 1.20 marks to 108.80 marks, a new bourse session high.
Bayerische Hypo was also a top gainer, rising 67 pfennigs to 58.45 marks, and Dresdner Bank AG was up 35 pfennigs at 74.35 marks.
But Commerzbank was down 15 pfennigs at 54.05 marks.
Retailer Karstadt AG, which had surged more than 100 marks this week on takeover speculation, slumped on Friday down 22.50 marks to 671.50 marks.
